I came home from a long Saturday night and it happened to be on. As I was watching all the nostalgia came rushing back to me(about where Cyndi Lauper starts singing "Goonies R Good Enough"). What a great movie, you will never see something like this made today, it had some mature themes(although nothing really that bad) and kids were allowed to be kids back then. What's great about it is that the kids are real, swearing and all, and are not being tracked on GPS like many kids of today. Some people complain about the acting and the dialogue, but what are people expecting from a movie targeted towards children and preteens? The main attraction in movie's like this is the adventure, and with a man like Spielberg behind it, the adventure sure didn't disappoint. Adding the production values of a summer blockbuster adventure to a children's movie was pure genius. Anyone who can't appreciate this movie was probably forced against their will to do the "Truffle Shuffle" when they were younger.

i love this film i loved it when i first watched it and whenever i watch it again it takes me back to being a kid in the 80s what a great decade to be a kid i think everyone had there own goonie clan where they just went out exploring i know i did but our exploring didn't go as far at the films did but it was fun none the less. of course the film is dated now but can any of you tell me that you don't wish you were that age again. only one other film makes me remember the 80s fondly and thats gremlins but thats a Christmas movie goonies is for summer and another point can any of you watch that data kid without laughing even having seen the film umpteen times

Review title: This movie stands the test of time
Review_body: This is one of the best movies of all time. I fell in love with it as a young kid the first time I watched it on television with my younger sister.The cast works perfectly for this story, the comedy is top notch and appeal lasts forever. One of the best things about the Goonies is so many of us have become a "Goonie". I myself use the name in most of my monikers including for these reviews here at IMDb.With the advancement of film making capabilities The Goonies is starting to look dated, but I still enjoy every minute of it. My wife and I can usually snap out of any bad mood or "funk" when we see Chunk and the Gang get together in this teenage riot.

I still find it impossible to believe that some people consider this to be "the movie of their childhood". I saw it as totally mean-spirited (especially with the Spanish-only speaking au pair:  NO kids movie should allow kids to get away with tricking someone into thinking a house is loaded with sundry drugs/sexual torture devices that do not exist).Whatever.

This is one of the best childhood adventure films of all times. I've probably seen it at least thirty times. I used to watch it at least once a month. The story of a motley crew of kids searching for treasure to save their town is just so enthralling. I love all the characters. They all have a memorable characteristic and a quotable line. I love that the villain is a scary old lady and her mama's boy sons. The acting is great, the picked the cream of the crop in child stars. I love the Babyruth part, and when mama Fertteli pulls the pearls out of mouths mouth! Also the kissing scene is priceless. I think this is a movie everyone should see. I fall in love with it again every time I watch it. It's funny and exciting and just one of those cheesy feel good 80's films you can't live without.

Review title: Highly Overrated - Childhood Memories make the rating of most people not the movie
Review_body: This basically is 100 Minutes of people screaming at each other. It's hardly bearable. Really. There is almost not a single minute of normal volume talking in this movie. Screaming, shouting, screaming from beginning to the end.They have a cool adventure and the story is funny enough for children and some adults. This is why I give 5 stars and not 2.The music is terrible too. Slapstick Sound effects in some situation make it even worse.When this was released it might have been cool and appropriate and especially children don't care so much about the screaming, so this made it great for many who today still like the film because of their children-bias.But really, seen from the eyes of an adult, today in 2014? 5 Stars at best.

Review title: An Adventure I would have loved to have been part of
Review_body: The Goonies is undeniably a cult classic. Favored by Kids, teens and adults. This film is the reason I have loved movies. It is part of my childhood. And provides adventure, imagination,mystery,thrills,humor and action.From the opening scene we are introduced to the gang and the villains. The Score is mysterious and magical and is absolutely magnetic. The locations are superbly beautiful. ECola park is a location I have to see some time in my life. The cinematography is majestic most notably in the end showing the ship sailing away. Which gives me goosebumps all the time. The sets are just amazing. The set designers and production designers showed the adventure we want to be a part of. The Waterslides that shoot out the protagonists to the cave filled with an aroma of water which holds One Eyed Willies ship is a spectacular moment. One I have enjoyed a lot.The direction is handled perfectly by Donner. The film also has that essence of Spielberg due to the man himself. Without him this would not have been as good. Chris Columbus, I feel is very underrated and has created a magical script filled with beloved characters which are portrayed superbly.This film is fantastic. I recommend you go watch it. It will please the kid inside you and have a great adventure. One you can enjoy moment after moment. Just make sure you do the Truffle Shuffle after.
This movie is a classic, I may watch it and love it out of nostalgia but I think it stands the test of time and has everything you want in a family film.
This is one of those perfect movies. Absolutely no complaints, from the story to the cinematography to the characters. 😙👌 Perfection

this is one those movies i can watch over and over again... have lost count of the number of times I've seen it in total.a local gang of kids calling themselves the goonies stumble across a treasure map and go on one last adventure together, encountering booby traps, a vicious mafia family, and a lovable deformed mutant.just brilliant fun all the way through. classic Spielberg the way he used to make movies. pure escapism from start to finish. likable characters, entertaining story.. well what more can i say about this film.pix
Watched this for the first time in the 90s and now here we are years later and this is still one of my favorites!

Review title: This is one of my all-time favorite movies from my childhood.
Review_body: Wow! I can't even tell you how many times I've seen this movie. I could sit and tell you each line and what is going to happen next. This movie is a classic from the 80s and a good memory from my childhood. "This is our time" and "Hey, you guys!" are favorite lines. The Goonies is a good conversationalist piece because people remember it and love it. It has a good story and not bad acting. Sean Astin is a cutie in this movie. We all know that we had friends that we did crazy things with when we were kids. This movie just lets us remember them (well not looking for treasure, but something close).

This is such an entertaining film. The kids (who today, are no longer kids)really held it together. Sean Astin as the pubescent, not so healthy dreamer who fills his friends with hope, and Josh Brolin as his older brother, handsome even at that age, leading their friends in the quest of their young lives...to save their homes from the <obligatory and hateful> land baron and his vapid son. But the villans, especially Robert Davi as Jake Fratelli, keep this movie moving along. Mama Fratelli (Anne Ramsey), evil and partial to her son, Francis (Joe Pantoliano)growls and sputters delightfully. Robert Davi, however, crooning Italian opera, made the biggest impression on me. This movie made me a big fan. His delivery, presence and comic badness coupled with that incredible singing voice and unforgetable face keeps me looking for his name in newly released films. Goonies was a wonderful introduction to Mr. Davi and, since Profiler is in reruns, I hope to see him in more featured roles.

Review title: This is one of the greatest films of the 20th century!
Review_body: No matter who you are, or where you live, The Goonies should always stand out in your mind as one of the greatest movies churned out of tinsel town. I am so happy that this film has not only touched me, but many people the world over. This film is probably the most important film of my childhood. I can remember many a rainy day where my Dad would take me to the local video store to hire a film and we I would always pick up the same video.....The Goonies. After 12 years things don't change. It still rains in England, and I still watch The Goonies on a regular basis. Didn't we all at one time, wish that we were a Goonie huh? I personally always wanted to be Mikey, leading the gang to "One Eyed Willy". It's that kind of interaction that is missing from films today. I just hope that the good people at Warner Brothers and Amblin Entertainment deside to release it on DVD. This film deserves to be dusted and polished digitally so that future generations of young kids can enjoy it as much as I have. Whoever you are young or old and haven't so already, I strongly suggest that you watch The Goonies. I hope it touches you as much as me. With rumors of a script going around Hollywood to do a sequel, now is an excellent time to catch the original and see why it is worth a sequal! For anyone who doesn't love this film all I can say is.....I don't understand. Everyone should love this film!

Review title: Brilliant! An instant family movie classic.
Review_body: Fantastic! You won't find a better family adventure flick than The Goonies. Fun for all ages. I must have seen it about thirty five times... NO JOKE! Any viewer will instantly fall in love with the hilarious 'Chunk'. I can picture myself when I am 65 still laughing at this film and taking me back to my adventurous childhood! Take my word watch this film it's a family classic.

Review title: Magic, I'm going to search the sewer and find treasure below my house!
Review_body: What a truly inspiring film to go and get out of the house and into the wildlife and explore the surrounding area around your house. I am now 19 and the movie makes me want to call up all my old friends from grammer school and invite them to go on a treasure hunt down the local sewer and find some diamond rings somebody flushed down the toilet. The film was fantastic, it brought back so many memories of my childhood and Chunk was so familiar to me that I could have sworn that it was a take off of me. I bought this film on video and still watch it every couple of months or so. If you have a child whinging at home and go and hire out the Goonies and sit back and watch it with the kids. It is absolute magic, and a classic that will never be forgotten. See if you can pick which one is Sam Gamgee in Lord of the Rings! I wish there really was pirate ships and other buried treasure around the place, infact form tomorrow I am quitting my job and am going to come and explorer, all thanks to the Goonies. P.S. To the person who wrote the script and picked the right actors *KISS*

I just can't understand how can anyone give it a 10 star rating. Don't get me wrong, am a fan of this genre, but this movie from the get go is a noisy annoying mess. It was extremely hard to get through the whole movie.

I've watched this movie so many times over the years because it's just plain fun. Some of the stuff is a little dated at this pint, but most of the movie holds up really well because of the chemistry between the kids, the fun/exciting story, and the action. I still try to watch it at least once every year.
This is just one of those classics everyone grows up with. The kids seem like real kids youd grow up with as a kid. GOOD MOVIE.

So I was about 15 when this thing came out. I never saw it, but over the years have heard good things and fond memories related to it. I decided to give it a shot - I tend to like these kid-venture movies from the 80s.Right away the red flags started popping up. Music by Danny Elfman. Oh no. That annoying staccato-strings and the cello trills splashed all over the place when something's supposed to be cutesy-funny. Oh the cringing right from the get go.That unbelievably annoying Asian kid from Indiana Jones (Mr Jones! Mr. Jones!). Oh no. Oh no.Back to the cutesy-funny. That's all this movie is - attempts at this type of entertainment that just fall flat.I could go on, but man I just hated this film. It was the Spielberg cutesy era that started with E.T., although E.T. was WAY better than this Goonies garbage. And why are they called The Goonies, anyway??

Warning: If you haven't seen this movie, (And I advise you to :) I might give away little details about it, so be forewarned.The Goonies is by far my favorite movie of all time. I remember seeing it for the first time at my cousin's house on T.V. when we were eight. Then, it was just a funny movie that had a funny fat kid, some other funny kids, and a funny-looking guy who yelled funny stuff. Now, it's definitely the best.It's about 4 boys (Mikey, [who was always my favorite,] Data, Mouth, and Chunk) who are about to be separated because their housing development is going to be torn down to make room for a snotty country club golf course (headed by none other than the boys' least favorite person's father)The boys go up in the attic and find a treasure map. Thinking that they might be able to find the treasure and be able to "save to goon docks," they set off on what will be the biggest Goonie adventure they've ever done!It's rated PG, although there's an awful lot of swearing. No "f-words", but they say "shit" about every other sentance, and "damn" occasionally, so if you're gonna watch this with younger kids, think about it first. In all, I rate it a definite 10, for hilarious mishaps, fun quotes, great fun, and 'the funny fat kid'. :) (It's in English, by the way.)"...con las cucarachas, por DOS semanas, sin agua y sin comeda!" - Mouth, in the "Translate into Spanish for Rosalita" scene

I absolutely love this film! When i was growing up i watched it nearly every day, a bit before school and the rest after! In my opinion it is the best family / kids film ever... great story, cracking cast, wonderful wonderful film! Mouth was always my fav. goonie as i was pretty similar as a kid! The best part of the film for me is any scene with sloth! He is a true screen king! If you want to watch a film with your kids or girlfriend or if you just want to enjoy an easy well scripted well acted funny film the goonies is the answer. It's fantastic!"hey chunk i've got some naked pictures of your mum! wanna buy them?"

Without getting into a slanging match with the previous 5 or so comments, I have to say, "people are you puritans with no imagination". This film is superb, it would rank along one of the first films I would ever show my kids as I know they would love it. Cussing ? not a lot ? The scene with Rosita wasn't racist in any way, just funny.Goonies is a 80's throwback movie that became one of the kids hits of the decade (along with Back to the Future, Teenwolf and the two Star Wars sequels) It tells of a group of kids who find a treasure map and embark on a two hour thrill to recover the lost treasure of One-Eyed Willy.Amusing, great characters and superb script probably sums it up the best and I urge you all to watch the movie, show your kids and your kids kids - to the rest of you who are taking the film far too seriously - get a life, get an imagination, and get out more....
One of the greatest films made. Grew up on this. Perfect adventure film.

Review title: A real treat of a movie that anyone should watch.
Review_body: I saw this film for the first time when it was in the cinemas at Portugal. I was very young and I really enjoyed it. The adventures, the cast, the plot, the ending, and all the climax were really exciting. After a few years, I stumbled onto it on my local video store, and in a day I watched it another five times. Later, I bought a copy, and since that day I watch it very often. My greatest hope is that Rich Donner will do a sequel with the same cast (much older), but still a good cast.

There was a time when boys would spend a whole day watching their favorite
heroes, dreaming of riding a crusade against Darth Vader's Empire or
fighting the enemies among the Knights of the Round Table. Just like in
the
Fantasy Island, where Mr. Roarke and Tatoo would make all one's wishes
come
true, The Goonies has the special talent to bring our childhood fantasies
back and remind us how great those years were.In this 1985 movie, a bunch of kids find a map which indicates the spot
where the evil pirate One-Eyed-Willie buried a big treasure stolen from
English ships in the 1500's. As we can predict, they decide to seek for
the
gold and precious stones to help their parents who are about to be
expelled
from their homes because they can't make ends meet and also because some
wealthy men want to put their houses down to build a country club on it's
place. Dangers, traps and even a family of thieves - the Fratelli - are
after them.As the film goes on, we can see how closer the friends get and how
supportive we all should be. They would always be there for each other, no
matter how deep their problems are. Even a rich girl, Andy, is accepted by
the group, in a very politically correct act, where no distinctions are
made. The scene in which the guys are stuck in a hole, is very touching
and
really digs our sense of aid.Richard Donner directed this movie and another famous director, Chris
Columbus wrote the screenplay, based on a Steven Spielberg's story. Matt
Sweeney was responsable for the special effects and the main theme ( They
'r
good enough ) was written and performed by Cindy Lauper.After the film, none of the kids became famous actors. Corey Feldman and
Kerry Green took part in some teenage comedies, while Sean Astin showed up
in "Memphis Belle" and Ke Huy Quan was the young Indiana Jone's chinese
taxi
driver in "The Temple of the Doom". The only one who joined some serious
projects was Martha Plimpton.But these are just technical details. What really counts in "The Goonies"
are the two hours of humanity, pleasure, inocence, friendship - and even
the
first love - that only children can show in their eyes. In fact, it's a
small journey to our past, to a time when your deepest worries were about
the girl (or the boy) on the next chair.

There was a time when boys would spend a whole day watching their favorite heroes, dreaming of riding a crusade against Darth Vader's Empire or fighting the enemies among the Knights of the Round Table. Just like in the Fantasy Island, where Mr. Roarke and Tatoo would make all one's wishes come true, The Goonies has the special talent to bring our childhood fantasies back and remind us how great those years were.In this 1985 movie, a bunch of kids find a map which indicates the spot where the evil pirate One-Eyed-Willie buried a big treasure stolen from English ships in the 1500's. As we can predict, they decide to seek for the gold and precious stones to help their parents who are about to be expelled from their homes because they can't make ends meet and also because some wealthy men want to put their houses down to build a country club on it's place. Dangers, traps and even a family of thieves - the Fratelli - are after them.As the film goes on, we can see how closer the friends get and how supportive we all should be. They would always be there for each other, no matter how deep their problems are. Even a rich girl, Andy, is accepted by the group, in a very politically correct act, where no distinctions are made. The scene in which the guys are stuck in a hole, is very touching and really digs our sense of aid.Richard Donner directed this movie and another famous director, Chris Columbus wrote the screenplay, based on a Steven Spielberg's story. Matt Sweeney was responsable for the special effects and the main theme ( They 'r good enough ) was written and performed by Cindy Lauper.After the film, none of the kids became famous actors. Corey Feldman and Kerry Green took part in some teenage comedies, while Sean Astin showed up in "Memphis Belle" and Ke Huy Quan was the young Indiana Jone's chinese taxi driver in "The Temple of the Doom". The only one who joined some serious projects was Martha Plimpton.But these are just technical details. What really counts in "The Goonies" are the two hours of humanity, pleasure, inocence, friendship - and even the first love - that only children can show in their eyes. In fact, it's a small journey to our past, to a time when your deepest worries were about the girl (or the boy) on the next chair.

Review title: The greatest comedy film ever made!
Review_body: Simply put, this is the greatest movie of the 80s.  No question.  What more can you ask for than a movie that has chunk do the truffle shuffle?  More quoteables than you could ever want from a movie!  "Rocky road?", "First you gotta do the truffle shuffle", "jerk alert". The DVD is highly recommended as the entire 7 goonies come back to do audio commentary and reveal cool details.  If you haven't seen this movie buy it!!!! It will soon be your favorite.  It is the funniest movie ever made.  With the best child actors ever assembled in one movie.  I've probably seen this movie 100 times and can't wait to see it 100 more.

Review title: Forget Raging Bull, this is the Greatest movie of the 80's!
Review_body: The goonies is the greatest kids film ever made. simple as that. It transports you to the childhood world of adventure better than any other film.

Review title: Part of growring up in the 80's
Review_body: I just watched this film for at least the 5th time and it is just a great, funny bit of escapism. It takes me right back to being a kid in the 80's, and almost anyone who grew up then who by some weird twist of fate hasn't seen this should watch it immediately.There is some great comic acting. I don't know why Corey Feldman hasn't done more - his performance as the wisecracking Mouth really stands out. The scene at the beginning where he shows the maid around the house still makes me laugh.This is a kids film I am absolutely 100% unashamed to enjoy at the age of 32. If I have kids, I can't wait to watch it with them.Hollywood gets a lot of stick for churning out dumb movies these days, and it hasn't made family entertainment likes this for a long time. For me, this is Hollywood family entertainment at it's best.

Hi you all.I chatted a while with my girlfriend about the movie The Goonies.We were both wondering what happened to John Matuszak.We are now sad, because of the death of this man.Can you imagine, we have both a very, very different background, and we both were thinking about his character in The Goonies...A mix of brutality and gentleness.A nice man in the corpse of a monster. What a concept, for us kids...I wish he had impressed a lot of kids, such as us... Just like we were.And we miss him.

This is one of the best adventure films i have ever seen. I was too young to see it when it was first released, but i have watched countless times since then, and it's one of those films you keep watching, over & over because although you know every single detail of the film, you have to go back to it. The actors were pretty good for their age, and the comedy element still creases me up. I'd recommend this film to anyone of any age. I'm glad there wasn't a sequel though, this is a one off classic.

although it's beginning may Put a few off i love this movie so does my parents my mom is like obsessed with this i love it sooooo much but i cant find a copy of the dvd TRUFFLE SHUFFLE ROX!!!!! I LOVE THE CHARACHTERS SOOO FREAKIN MUCH!!! sometimes mikeys speeches are stupid and sometimes sloth gets annoying but it makes an awesome beach flick to watch, but this is only my opinion some others may not like it as much and thats ok but next time ur @ a rental store look for this movie it is hilarious at parts go now and get it! GOONIES!!!!!

Richard Donner has always been known for making fast-paced and fun movies. Most people probably associate his name with the Lethal Weapon series.  But whenever I hear his name, I always think of The Goonies.The Goonies is one of those movies that always brings out the kid in me. Everytime I watch it, I fall in love with it all over again.  This isn't the usual teensploitation flick, filled with glamorous, ultra-cute teenagers with whom you can't relate.  These are characters you can relate to.  The kind you could swear lived right down the street from you.  It's hard to not become attached to them and their circumstances.  So when they fall head-first into the adventure of a lifetime, they take you along for the ride.The awesome thing about this movie is that you feel like a member of the group all the way thru the movie.  You feel like one of "the goonies".  All the way from the beginning to the end.  It all starts when they find a mysterious treasure map in Mikey's (Sean Astin) attic.  This then triggers a chain of events which eventually puts them into an adventure of Indiana Jones-esque proportions.  As they dodge the many pitfalls and problems that come their way, you find yourself rooting for them, and almost feeling like you're a part of the action.  Never will there be another movie as fun as this one.The acting in this movie is top notch, considering the majority of the actors and actresses were pre-teens at the time of filming.  Like I said, these characters are everyday characters you swear were ripped straight from your childhood.  Sean Astin is great as Mikey, a teen in his early, and awkward, pubescent years.  He's kind of the all-round average guy, but is the glue that holds the group together, thus being the hero.  Josh Brolin is great as his older brother, Brandon.  He does everything you picture an older brother to do: picks on Mikey and his friends and acts like a toughguy, while at the same time adding some guidance and looks out for his younger bro.  Chunk, my favorite character, is played brilliantly by Jeff Cohen.  I never fail to laugh at him bumbling around and shooting his mouth off.  Corey Feldman is in top form here as "Mouth", playing the part of the cool guy (as usual).  Jonathan Ke Quan is hilarious as "Data", a child genius with all kinds of quirky little inventions to help his friends out along the way (yet not very skilled at using them just yet).  Kerri Green is great in being the pretty face of the movie as Andrea ("Andy" for short), and is a possible love interest of Brandon.  Martha Plimpton is good as Andy's friend, but doesn't have too many lines.  She does provide good chemistry between her and Mouth, though, hinting at a possible relationship in the future.  The Fratelli family is portrayed quite well by Davi, Pantoliano, and Ramsey.  I'd say they do a sufficient job at being as scary as possible in their given roles as a family of hot-headed criminals out to find a stash of treasure, thus bumping heads with the kids and posing much of a threat.This movie might not carry the same worth with others as it does with me, given it's nostalgic value.  So I must admit that my views may be a little biased.  But, I feel that this film works on all levels at providing comedy, adventure, and thrills galore.  If you're looking for a fun movie to watch, I HIGHLY recommend giving The Goonies a chance.  I know very few people who have been disappointed with this movie, so I think it's definitely worth a shot.  It's too hard not to fall in love with this move and it's characters.
Recently revisited this film and it's as delightful now as it was in 85! Time to share it with a new generation of young people.
My family and I watch this film every year. Fun for the whole family!

Review title: We need more movies like this!
Review_body: I absolutely love this movie! It is such as fun, feel good movie. So funny! I want more movies like this haha! Watch it... you will not be disappointed.

Not to sure what to say about this Film 🎥. But PLEASE DO NOT REMAKE THIS MASTERPIECE. This was and still is One of my favorite Film's of all Times. Do the Truffle Shuffle that was a very funny line. Just the look on the young actors face. Grrr Ok then Jump up on that Big Rock and lift up his Shirt and do that Dance with the noice.

I love the Goonies because it's silly. It's a classic movie dealing with kids on an adventure to save their home from being foreclosed. The leader of the Goonies, Mikey (played by an adorable Sean Astin), finds a map of an ancient pirate's ("One-Eyed Willy") treasure. The Goonies follow the map and wind up in caves deep underground and have to keep their wits about them to get to the coveted treasure. The characters are extremely comical, and there is an element of romance between Andy (a cute cheerleader) and Brand (Mikey's older and hunky brother). I will never get tired of the movie, simply because it is silly and it fun to watch. The story is so out there that you can't help but like it. It makes you want to be a part of the adventure and makes you feel like a kid again.

This was one of my favorite movies as a child, and now, having been blessed with a wonderful DVD version, maybe, just maybe, someday...sniffle it'll be my kid's favorite too...sniffle..God willing. Really, though. Great flick, lotsa great stuff, funny, scary, action packed, just plain great. Goonies never say die.

This is one of the best movies made! It is enjoyable for everyone, children and adults as well.  The acting is great, and the plot is great too.  It's a movie you will love, and so will your parents. You will never get tired of it.  I have nothing bad to say about this movie. I really hope they make a second one.  Sean Astin(Mikey) and Corey Feldman(Mouth) are too cute! =D

if this is not the greatest film ever made, i dont know what i will do to myself.  You can keep all your citizen kanes because when i watch a movie i am looking for 100% entertainment.  And luckily enough this film provides 101% entertainment. I could talk about how much i love this film all day and how brilliant all the characters are.  But the single greatest part of the film is the relationship between sloth and chunk.  They both would be amazingly funny by themselves but pair them together and you have the single greatest comic duo on the face of the planet. How can you not laugh when they are declaring their love to each other or the lines which sloth comes out with, "hey you guys" for instance.  But my favourite line is where chunk screams, "its a stiff".  It still has me in stitches at the 100th viewing.

From the start of the opening credits of Ma and her two sons fleeing through Astoria at high speeds whilst introducing us to a small band of kids who we lovingly came to know as the Goonies, to a pirate ship sailing into the distance which puts POTC to shame with it's authentic grace 'The Goonies' is one of those movies which aimed to please and did so much more.It's the grand adventure which every child young and old wishes they could have lived and nigh on twenty years later still impresses. The eighties produced some memorable movies in it's decade and 'The Goonies' along with others stands the test of time. With the small band of heroes Mikey, Mouth, Chunk and Data with the addition of some older but non the wiser teenagers of Brand, Andi and Steph we are taken on the grandest adventure with the simplest of terms. A treasure hunt. Every trick in the book is thrown in, A car chase, a treasure map with cryptic clues, dubloons, pirates, underground caves, dead guys, bad guys, pirate ships and skeletons. And of course Sloth.It's the stuff fairy tales couldn't get enough of and yet it was so real you almost wished yourself to Astoria to live the grand adventure itself. You can't help but laugh at each small intricate detail to the sarcasm of Mouth and how to 'pack the drugs' to poor Chunk relaying his life story to save his poor fingers from the blender. Throw in Mikey to touch the soft spot in your heart and raise a tear, and Data who has a gadget to get you out of every situation. Andi and Brand provide the romance, although in saying Mikey gets a look in too and Steph tries and fails to provide the adult expertise before reverting to perfect sarcasm battles with Mouth. And all this whilst being chased by the Fratelli's.All in all, praise upon praise cannot say how good 'The Goonies' is, I was five when it was released, and it's been a favourite from then, although I do remember being scared of Sloth at the time. I killed off the version I watched and re-watched and re-watched recorded onto video from all those years ago, bought it on VHS and killed that version too, Thankfully DVD's are that little bit more hard wearing. I hope to be watching it in another twenty years time and still loving it.

The first time I saw THE GOONIES was at a friend's house right when it was a "new release" on video. After the best times I had in my life watching it, the friend established a "Goonie" club for the fun of it. Perhaps your past childhood memories would have been the same, too! While the movie is a tad heavy on the stupid foul jokes, it does have the imagination of willing to trek around for some perilous adventures, plus a few spooks. There possibly was never a movie like this providing tons of fun and laughter during the time. The characters and their personalities were most original, including "Data" and his supply of gadgets, and "Chunk" with his obese but likable image (love that "Truffle Shuffle"!). But "Sloth" easily stole the show with his own likable personality, a goon with the weirdest face I've ever seen in my life! Just think of how fun it is to discover lost treasure, when you know it's only fantasy. Four key things come to mind with THE GOONIES: pirate ships, teenagers, the Frattellis, and Cyndi Lauper. They're actually "good enough" and they go together in this memorable journey! Kudos to Richard Donner for bringing me a movie that I've seen over 100 times and never stop enjoying! After all these years, I'm STILL waiting for a sequel! HIT PUREE!!!

Review title: One of the all time best movies
Review_body: Let me start by saying if you've read any negative reviews try to keep in mind these are people who never learned the lesson "if you don't have anything good to say, don't say anything at all." There's a huge difference between saying "it's not for me" and running it into the ground. Whining about children yelling in a movie mostly cast with children, is kind of idiotic.That being said, The Goonies is one of the quintessential movies of the 80's, and it has never lost its shine. This movie is easily a 10, it will always be a 10...even after you've watched it over and over. It never gets stale. I loved it at 15 years old and I love it at 40 years old. It captures a little bit of everything...action, romance, drama, adventure, suspense..all wrapped in your childhood. If you want to have a good time, sit down and pay attention to this movie. A fun rousing adventure. Each of the actors and actresses (as well as writers and director, basically everyone involved) should be given a posthumous Oscar award, for touching people so artistically. I found it extremely distasteful someone called out Martha Plimpton and put her down over others. She was in integral part of the whole mixture. The movie just works. It's like magic in a bottle. Naysayers, take a hike...no one cares what you think.

A classic kids film that all also brings out the youngster in adults. You can't help but will them on, laugh at their banter and split your sides at the now legendary hufle-shuffle by the chubby kid in the film.A bunch of kids going off to search for lost treasure to help save their parents house which is being demolished for a corporate golf course is an ideal set up for childhood heroism and adventure. Spooky in parts it was said to be based on a real happening of the writer/director Steven Spielberg.  From start to finish it's an enjoyable ride with certain moral tendencies in parts and a bit of brotherly sentimentality that does it no harm. a true classic film of the eighties, highly recommended.
Joke of a man... get back to rating starsigns! 20 out of a hundred! I'm guessing Lucas nailed your wife

the goonies is an outstanding piece of invention right from the begging with the truffle shuffle i was creased up the way they all set out to look for willies long lost treasure to save their homes and town is just amazing. however everyone knows to make a good film you have bad guys in it and of course these bad guys are so annoying with wanting the treasure for themselves but as usual the goonies are all there to save the day and prove them wrong by trying their hardest to get to the treasure before the bad guys do and its amazing with data's inventions from slick shoes to his teeth that grab onto things when falling, and the famous line i will always remember is "data hates falling, data has had enough of falling." it is my favorite line ever and the way it ends is just amazing with the ship going off in the background setting sail for its next adventure.
I watched this movie so much when I was a kid I wore out cassette tapes all the time. My group of friends referred to ourselves as The Goonies.

This is a film i always used to watch when i was little and from time to time i still watch it and it never looses steam.this film has an adventure type feel to it that i really love, and this film i very very funny and the jokes never get old to me and always makes me laugh. the characters in this film are brilliant and work extremely well together and it leads to some really funny moments.i don't want to give away what they are doing because it will make the film more exciting and let you discover things more.overall this movie is a funny adventurous journey and once you see it you will never stop watching it

This movie is awesome. It has great characters and a good plot. It is a great movie to watch, and Mouth is probably my favourite. Chunk and Data are both funny too. Some parts in this movie are priceless, and make it an enjoyable film to watch. The main four kids (Mikey, Mouth, Data, and Chunk) all contributed something to the film, but the only thing about this movie that doesn't make sense is what are the other three there for? I guess Brand and Andy add an extra element, but I honestly don't see the purpose of Stef's character. Oh well, all in all, this movie was great and I would definitely recommend it, for young and old people alike, this movie is a classic.

Review title: I don't understand why everyone loves this film?
Review_body: I watched this film after it being recommended to me by lots of different people, and I'm sorry but I don't see the appeal at all. I went into the film with big expectations. I wanted to watch a funny, enjoyable and all round family film, but I finished it wondering why I spent my time on a lazy, boring and basically dumb movie. I don't understand the choice to have every kid in the film just try and shout over each other, through the screaming I could barely make out any of the dialogue and when it finally seemed to settle down, what I could make out of the script was that it was just lazy writing, everything was just too convenient. Everyone's entitled to their own opinion and mine is that the action and characters are just plainly implausible and the whole film is just a bore from start to finish. I hear the excuse of "it's a kids film" and to me, that just seems like a poor excuse for a film you think is infallible because it's a nostalgic movie and was one of you're favourites growing up however sometimes people don't want to accept the truth and yet the truth is that it's actually just a ridiculous and stupid 2 hour mess!!! I have a good friend who I rely on for film recommendations and she said to me "you've got to accept that it's an 80's kids film" and I do, it's just that Back to the Future was released in the same year, merely 2 weeks apart, with the same certificate, and to me there isn't a comparison between which film is better. Back to the future for me is a film which ages like fine wine, whereas Goonies, I hate to say it but it's aged as well as a PT cruiser.
Takes me back everytime, still one of my favorite movie of all time. 1632 just saying :)

The Goonies was an amazing movie. I remember watching this at young age and just falling in love with it. It's a classic 80s movie that still brings excitement and joy to anyone who watches it. Although it did come with it's pg-13 scenes, it still will find a way in anyone's heart, if they're willing to open up to it.Even the shots the director uses to portray what will happen bring out real thought and creativity. I haven't watched the movie in a while, but I can tell you, you won't ever really forget it. There are some many classic scenes, like when one character yells, "Hey you gu-uys!", it really just sticks with you. If you plan to watch this movie, watch it with a friend, because everyone should be able to enjoy this film.

Review title: The greatest kid adventure of all time
Review_body: This movie is my favorite of all time! No other movie better captures the adolescents' adventure taste than this movie! Long Live the Goonies!

I grew up with all the Steven Spielberg movies from the 80's, and The Goonies is one of them (Spielberg wrote the story). This movie is a great adventure, perfect for both the young ones and the old ones. The characters are very interesting and some are really funny. They have their own life and their own story to tell. And together they make this movie to something special. I can only remember one other movie that I can compare to this one; Stand By Me (Corey Feldman has a role in this movie and in The Goonies). Almost the same characters and a bit of an adventure (even though it is more quite and slow in a sense). See The Goonies and become a part of a real Spielberg Adventure!

The Goonies is my all-time favorite movie. I've seen it hundreds of times and I never get tired of it. It came out when I was 5 years old and I remember being so facinated by the adventure & props, especially the pirate ship. I've had the video for some time now, and the only reason I got a DVD player was because they just put the Goonies out on DVD with the cut-scenes.
This movie is what friendships are made of. That's the best thing about the movie, I think. What could be more fun & exciting than an all-out adventure complete with pirate ships, booby traps, & a treasure at the end? Going through it with your best friends!I'm 22 and this is still one of me & my friends' favorite things to do- hang out, watch the Goonies & recite every single word!

This movie is basically one of my all time favorites, because you can feel the adventure that they are going through. I love each character and story behind them. I've watched this movie religiously and still enjoy it at what age I am. I really don't find any bad things about this movie. The plot is great, the characters are lovable and enjoyable, the villains are great in every aspect.

Review title: aren't we all a little goonie?
Review_body: I was about the age of the goonies when I saw this movie in theatres.  It was my favorite movie instantly!  I purchased the book (based on the movie??)and read it the week after seeing the movie.  The taste of adventure and the solving of the puzzles backed up nicely with humour made for a very enjoyable movie that still ranks in my top 5 of all time.

Being only 14, I found that most people my age, have never even heard of this film, forget seen it, I however adore it, and it has been my favourite film for three years. I only saw this because my mother had recorded it off channel five and not being a film fan, had promptly not watched it, leaving it to me to tell her about it. I watched it and instantly fell in love with it. Even though at times it's corny and unrealistic, the enthusiasm in the little people and the amazing story makes up for it completely. One friend I showed it to, disliked it, however I am under the impression she is a crazed lunatic, who has had the disadvantage of pretending to be mature and therefore missed out on the wonder that is 'The Goonies'! You can quickly connect with the characters and their need for excitement and adventure. One can laugh at their jokes, and generally all the crazy things they say; scream at the bad people and the giant squid and join in their amazing adventure. This film shows you seven children's last desperate attempt to remain in the home they love, with the friends they have been forced to make after the rest of the world rejected them. Like 'stand by me' it is a story of growth and heroism and how friendship is precious enough to die for.

So, I am currently in my living room with my kids as they watch Goonies. They LOVE it, and why not? When I was there age it was one of my all time fav movies. So, I start to wonder what ever happened to the actress that plays Andy...come over to IMDb and look up the movie The Goonies, 1985!!!!!!!!!!!!! Are you kidding me!!!!! 23 years ago, holy crap! Now I feel like such a freaking old fart. But still it's a great movie! And nice to see that it stands the test of time. The kids are laughing and totally into it. Plus there isn't any gore or questionable moments in it so I am not sitting here thinking of how I am going to explain any parts to them.

All my childhood was about this movie. My adventures in the forests. My imagination my taste in movies everything was about this movie. I love it soo much I can't wait to see it again tonight with my little siblings. And it's their first time seeing it.i'm sure they'll love it!

This is the definitive children/teenage movie that I think everyone should see at least once.The movie is very funny and element of adventure in the movie is also superb.All in all this is a movie that I think can be viewed over and over again without losing anything from the first experience.

Review title: THE BEST Movie of 1985!! Definitely holds up and doesn't rely on nostalgia!!
Review_body: This movie has everything! Adventure... Excitement... PIRATE TREASURE! WHAT?!?!In spite of local hater and irresponsible movie critic Will R., this movie effing crushes!!!I'd say it's better than any Kurt Russell film by about 69 miles.

This is the film that I use as a Litmus test to whether or not a person that I am talking with has good taste in movies. If they say they liked it, then I know we're going to have a difficult time picking out a movie to watch together. Now, I have to admit that I never saw this film as a kid. However, that does not mean that it gets a pass. A movie should be able to hold up, whatever stage of life the viewer is in. Some people have nostalgic memories associated with films like the Goonies, which confuses their judgment of the quality of the film. Just because it's something you grew up with does not mean it is something that other people should enjoy. There are several movies that I enjoyed as a kid that I still enjoy. Likewise, there are several movies that I did not like as a kid, that I still dislike. I'm sure that I would not like the Goonies now, even if I had seen it as a kid, because I'm sure I would not have liked it as a kid.

Review title: Only for Kids under 15 or maybe under 12
Review_body: This is a movie with a bunch of kids who save their part of the town from being turned into a golf course. There are lot of times in the movie when you might feel 'that's silly' but it might be a nice watch for the kids. Kids might have lot of fun watching a bunch a kids trying to pull off a breath taking treasure adventure. But for an adult mind it looks too childish and at times boring. I gave this 6 considering it might be lot of fun for kids under the age group of 15 or maybe 12 but I would have personally given it only 4 or 5 out of 10.Maybe I expected a lot from this as the story was from Steven Spielberg. But the whole movie is based on some impulsive events that take place all in one day. The connectivity is loose at many instances and the humour is real immature or too juvenile. The movie starts with a small introduction of each character but is very lame. Overall it's good if the kids want to watch some adventure flick but otherwise it's a total waste of time.

The Goonies is a must-see for anyone who love movies, it is a treasure. The film is about a batch of kids named The Goonies who find a treasure map in a attic. When one of them realise that this may actually lead them to treasure he and his buddies decide to go on a fascinating hunt for it in a effort to save them from being forced out of their homes. Along the way they meet three crooks and Sloth- a lovable character who makes friends with the "truffle shuffle kid" Chunk, after he is caught by the crooks, and together they go looking for his friends to rescue them. So i advise you, anyone who has not seen this movie watch it as you will certainly be missing out otherwise. You will like this movie if you like films such as "The Never-Ending Story", "Legend", "Gremlins" and "Labyrinth"

Review title: The Goonies...What else is there to say?
Review_body: This movie so defines everything that a child of the eighties wanted to be. I remember trying to find secret passages and treasure maps after watching this movie for the first time.  And who doesn't know where the classic "HEY YOU GUYS!" came from.  The Goonies will be awesome forever!I'm done.

Sean Astin  does an impeccable job as the lead character. (Mikey) He should be recognized for this pre-Lord of the Rings movie. Highly Recommended. A must see for adventure-loving children and adults alike.

I first saw this movie when I was about 6 years old, I watched it over and over again and I still do today. In fact, I remember when the Disney Channel featured this as a frequent movie and it still should be. I encourage anyone who hasn't seen this movie to either rent it or purchase it, it is definitely worth your time.

The Goonies has been my all time favorite movie ever since I was a kid. (around the time it was released). I have seen this movie hundreds and hundreds of times, and not once have I ever gotten tired of it. Whats NOT to love about The Goonies!?!?! This movie inspired me to be a little adventurous as a kid, always hoping that something amazing would happen! Haha! This is a movie that will last for generations! Goonies #1 in my book!!

Review title: I'm a Goonie and I never say die!
Review_body: I remember when I was growing up that I wanted be just like Captain Hook or Captain Jack Sparrow and have all the gold and treasure in the world. I wanted to go on treasure hunts with Peter Pan and call it all mineI made everything in my life an adventure. There were always new "caves" to discover and land that just had to have treasure in it somewhere. I was bound and determined to find it. The first time I watched The Goonies, I wanted to be as brave and determined as Mikey. I wanted to be a Goonie.When this movie caught my eye, I knew that we would have to have it. Adventure was my forte and I wasn't going to let this adventure slip through my fingers. It made me want to go find Mikey and say, "Hey lets go get that treasure together!" The movie is set in 1985 in Astoria, Oregon. Seven kids only have a few days left before their homes get bought and turned into a golf course. They are desperate to find anything that can help save their house. While digging around in the attic, Mikey finds a treasure map that leads to the legendary treasure of "One-Eyed" Willy. There adventure begins at an abandoned summer restaurant. It is owned by the wanted Fratelli thieves. Little do they know that trouble is coming their way when they hide in the fire place in the basement of the restaurant. This is a funny, action packed movie with twists and turns that will make you want more. Watch it and live the greatest adventure of your life.

This is a classic comedy movie from the 80s...i was born a few years after this movie even came out and i watch it is one of my favorites, this movie also appeals to adults too, as my parents and a few of my teachers claim this is one of their favorites... funny...but not stupid funny

When I was 6 years old, my parents took me to the movies to see The Goonies. I was immediately a fan at the age of six. The intrepid gang of friends, attempting one last try at having an adventure before they all have to move away from each other, the thrill of solving century-old puzzles, the suspense from the bad guys, the pirate-themed ending,...it had it all for a 6 year old. To this day, I don't think any other movie has captured my attention as much as this Richard Donner gem. I tip my hat off to you, Mr. Donner. You have a fan for life.

Review title: Possibly the greatest film in the World
Review_body: I love this movie. Every time it's on tv. I watch it. I have the video. I have the dvd. I know what the octopus looks like and I know it would have filled my pants if I'd seen it the first time I saw the movie.The Goonies will stand the test of time. I know this to be true. When I worked at a cinema I forced a cult film season to be shown and it was my one aim to get this on regardless. And it was on. And it sold out. In fact, it sold out and had to be moved to a larger screen to accomodate more people - and then it sold out again.Why? This film is timeless. Yes, the music holds it back and yes, it is a bit jumpy (the cinema print anyway) but there is nothing like this film and there will be nothig like this film. The only thing that comes remotely close is Indiana Jones. It is was and always will be original. No-one will ever top it.The Goonies. You know you love it.

Review title: Looking for a safe movie to just succumb to? Try this safe harbor in the pacific northwest. Great "Goonie" Relaxation.......
Review_body: I can remember seeing this several times in the theater with my friend Geoff Chisholm. Years later I would have the chance to see the house where the the "Walsh family home" was located (on a tour of Astoria, Oregon).Astoria, a safe harbor town in the peaceful pacific northwest is a rarity in this day and age. The film seemed to bring the town to life. Not featured in the film is a quaint street car line. It is quite a lovely place to spend a weekend and certainly the continued success of the film has contributed to its survival.One of the most interesting spots to visit in Astoria is the classic JC Penney store. The store on the outside resembles something from the 1930's. Inside you'll find much of the same contemporary merchandise you'd find at any JC Penney store in any mall. But Astoria, seems to have a magical ability to preserve its history and stay current at the same time.Same is true for this film. It doesn't SEEM like a 27 year old movie.But it is.Actually it isn't. The movie is the same. We are just all 27 years older.Watching it today through the prism of a man with 27 years of life experience doesn't make it any less exciting.The car chase on the beach.The creative gadgetry of "Data" sliding down the home made zip line. "Data" had a zip line BEFORE any one knew what a zip line was.Chunk knocking over the statue and "breaking Brandon's mother's favorite part".A very private part by the way.Jeff Burleson and Geoff Chisholm (we took the whole staff to a screening in Sisters, OR on Maple Lane at Loker Avenue) heartily recommend this film for anyone who loves teenage adventure, wholesome goodness and the hard work of Steven Spielberg BEFORE he became STEVEN Spielberg.

This movie has a lot of good memories for me as a child growing up in the 90s. When I watched this movie the first time I was around seven or eight years old and lived with both of my parents in a small house in Plant City FL. We lived right across the street from the Strawberry Festival.If you ever watch this movie and its your first time doing so then do yourself a solid and try to reach back into your childhood, (if your an adult), and imagine your seven to twelve year old self watching this. It would make a lot more sense if you did it that way. This movie was created with love and it shows in every single scene. The adult actors in the film were superb, the children actors did an amazing job, even Mouth who grew up to be, well not so great. I love every single one of them and every single time I see this movie it brings back the great childhood memories I had living in my childhood home. It also makes me want to turn back into a kid and go treasure hunting like they did in the film. I plan on doing this with my daughter. The music was awesome and fun, the settings were really well done and the ship was a real freaking Pirate Ship.Listen this isn't really a review just something to try and get you to see this movie with your kids or if you do not have any, then with yourself not going in and expecting a modern story because its nothing like that. Its a movie to be enjoyed with the heart and soul of a child looking for adventure not for adults looking for a serious down to earth film.

After 25+ years, I finally watched this movie with my daughter and after 45 minutes I had to leave the room. The CONSTANT screaming and yelling by all the characters was more than I could take. The dialog was stupid, the characters over-acted, the fat kid was annoying as hell, and the amount of plot holes made this laughable at best. The premise of the movie is great...a remake could do well, but as this stands I couldn't stand to hear one more second of it.And seriously, they cast Martha Plimpton??? Of all the struggling actors in Hollywood, this is who they picked? I guess they needed a homely girl that couldn't act, so they picked her (with Kerri Green being a close second).

I loved this movie as a kid, and guess what? I still love it today.Funny, cute charming, warm, exciting... what more can you want.I still keep hearing about the sequel which I don't want to see, because it could ruin this masterpiece. I LOVE CHUNK, but who doesn't.There's one thing to be said about a movie like this, and something this special doesn't hit the theaters very often. Thanks GOD for DVD.If you haven't seen this, than I urge to you rush out and buy a copy today.... you can thank me later ;)

Born in 1987, I was unfortunate enough not be alive at the release of The Goonies. However, as a child growing up it was a film I would see on the TV (usually around Christmas, when a lot of films were previewing) - and for some reason it would always be my luck to only grab the last hour or thirty minutes of the film.However, nearing the age of 7 years old, my dad set the timer for when it was on - he knew how much I wanted to see the whole episode! I watched it, at at 7 for a film, 9 years old. It became my favourite film ever.For me it just sums up childhood 'one big adventure' - now a fixture in my DVD collection, I could watch it every night of every week and never get boured. A film never to be forgotten!

The Goonies is an must-watch film. It has become an iconic film. It is a masterpiece in the sense that most of the adventure movies for kids follow it in one or another way. It has elements that make it unique. For instance, the weird Slot. There is no real reason for him, but still, there it is, and it makes the movie a classic. There is a few things that can be better, like kids not knowing where to go or what to do instead of them solving all the problems immediately. One thing we all want is an extended version, Is it real the octopus scene? The scenes at the town buying maps where good, and also introduces the bully and the relations with the girls. This movie deserved a second part, but unfortunately actors are now too old and a new remake cannot be better than original.

Review title: If you are an adult and haven't seen it already, then don't.
Review_body: I was 18 when this was released. Just a little bit too old for it. Over the decades I've heard people just a few years my junior rave about this as if it were an Indiana Jones or a gremlins or the like. So finally at the ripe old age of 46 I've had a look. I cannot believe the hype for this. The director's overriding instruction to the actors, seems to have been, shout and scream and say your dialogue whilst everyone else is saying theirs. That will keep the audience thrilled and excited. It gave this member of the audience a headache. The storyline is weak, the characters 2 dimensional and the script is dire. I kept thinking these kids must be off their Ritalin. It was like an onslaught of annoyance. I get that people are nostalgic for movies they saw when they were kids. I still think jaws is one of the greatest films ever made, whereas people younger than me can't abide the plastic shark. But really, I'm amazed that so many people still seem to rate this. I challenge anyone over 40 (in 2013), who hasn't already seen this movie as a kid, to like it!

I absolutely love this movie! There are unforgettable characters and who doesn't like kids cussing every other word? haha... The actors were perfect for their parts and each of them had their own personality; Mouth - the one who never shuts up ~ Chunk - the fat kid ~ Data - "Double O Negative" ~ Mikey - the believer ~ Andy - the cheerleader ~ Stef - the annoyed "babysitter" ~ Brand - the P-Oed older brother. I've seen this movie at least 70 -okay, well maybe not 70- times, and I always catch something different each time; like how Mouth is wearing a "Purple Rain" t-shirt. It's so hilarious and you can't imagine how many quotes you can memorize in one sitting! Gosh, I love this movie!

Not only was The Goonies a brilliantly written, directed, and acted movie, but it was also so much FUN! The adventures of these kids through the underground world, while being chased by the despicable villains known as the Fratellis, are fascinating to watch-movies.ga . The Goonies is a great cinematic experience. It has everything that anyone who was ever a kid could ever want. Even the elaborate sets are very convincing.

I loved this movie. I watched the summer between my freshmen and sophomore year. My favorite character was Data. It was the perfect adventure/fantasy movie. The kids saving the day and the neighborhood. My favorite scenes were where Mouth was translating into Spanish for Rosalita. Her reactions to his translation was funny. Josh Brolin was the perfect big brother for Sean Astin (son of the Riddler from the 60's Batman series). Mouth being scared and then becoming brave at the end was cool. I also remember Cyndi Laupers music video from this movie, I just don't remember the song that she sang, but the ending of the video was funny with her saying Mr. Spielberg get me out of here. This is a movie that I look forward to sharing with my kids. The DVD has the full movie being played with the cast (in current time) giving their thoughts during the commentary. A must have DVD for those who love the Goonies!

Review title: This Movie is One of the Best
Review_body: This movie is one of the best movies ever. I have read some comments that said that this movie was to childish and that it could never really happen. But this movie is not supposed to be about truth it is just supposed to be about fun for kids. It was clever and fun. If you are to old not to get the magic of the movie then you should not be watching it in the first place. Sure people of all ages watch it. I thought the movie was very well written. It portrays all the thoughts of little kids. What kid doesn't want to find treasure on a ship. I love all the characters even though Chunk is still my favorite. He is just so innocent and funny. I recommend this to anybody who loves a good fictional adventure.
A great adventure in a fun and interesting movie. A great movie for anyone look for entertainment
This movie has to be one of the greatest movies ever made.Magic!

Too many implausibilities to make this enjoyable.  There were plenty of good quips and jokes, but not enough to overcome many inconsistencies and ridiculous assumptions required of the viewer.  Actually, not a bad story for those under 8 years old, BUT the potty humor is only suitable for those 15 and over.  Bad combination.Spielberg should remove his name from this mess.

Review title: Goonies Never Say Die (nor does the movie go out of style!)
Review_body: What can I say about this movie?  Hmmm....awesome!  It was the first movie that I ever fell in love with.  Well, it was the first actor that I have ever fallen in love with - at the time. Sean Astin and all the others made the movie a wonderful treat to watch.  I got my best friend into it.  We both loved it so much that we began to write a sequel to it and almost (but not quite) succeeded.  We'd still love to see a sequel made, but it looks doubtful since talk of one years before this died out almost immediately due to lack of interest from many cast members.  It still is a classic kid's comedy.  I've got the whole thing practically memorized too, Ash!  Think they should have a 15-year anniversary re-release??

Review title: The greatest movie of all time!!!!!!!!!
Review_body: This is the best movie for people of all ages!  This movie teaches everybody just how important friendship really is.  This is one of those movies that you can watch again and again without getting bored.  In my opinion, Chunk is the best Goonie! To this day, I still crack up when I see Chunk do the Truffle Shuffle!  Owning this incredible movie is a must!!

Review title: One of the best adventure movies of the 80's
Review_body: They just don't make movies like this anymore.  I never get tired of 'The Goonies', as it reminds me of my childhood.  It's every boy's fantasy come true!  Buried treasure, pirate ships, booby traps, and BMX bikes!  It's the quintessential youth adventure movie.  If you haven't seen it yet, you may not think it's all that great, but if you saw it as a kid, the magic is still there.

Review title: Nostalgic escape from grown up worries.
Review_body: Whenever I find myself becoming over-stressed from my college workload; I take a break and pop in the Goonies. I work part time in a video store, and with all of the movies I can choose freely from, I still consistently watch this movie over any other. It probably symbolizes the 80's from a kid's point of view better than any other single film, and it brings me back to that time in my life when I didn't have to worry about exams, rent, and career choices. While I might not have searched for buried treasure, we all have those moments from childhood that we would like to live again. The Goonies is my piece of mind packaged in an endearing tale of friendship, adventure, and that timeless experience of childhood.

For anyone growing up in the 1980's, especially kids, this film is a great bit of nostalgia. I remember going to see it with my family back in 1985 and loving every minute of it. Even today as a film student I still enjoy it and somehow find the time to watch it at least twice a year. The story is good. The acting is okay, though the characters are quite memorable. Who can forget Data, Sloth, Chunk, Mouth, etc.? I know I can't. The music, especially the theme by Cyndi Lauper, is firmly set in the mid-80's which really adds to the nostolgic effect (I still have the 45!). The score is also good and I think it actually adds something to the feeling of the film. I would definately recommend this to anyone who was a kid in the early/mid 1980's. When I watch it I always feel like I've been taken back years to a whole different time and world. It really is a modern classic!

HEEEEY, YOU GUUUUYS....I can't even remember the first time I saw this movie.  I think of this film as a classic for anyone that grew up in the 80's.  It goes right along with, cool-aid, garbage pail kids and he-man & she-ra. It made every kid think anything was possible; that if they only truly believed, they could accomplish anything.  And if it didn't quite do that, it sure was (is) a good action movie to watch over and over again.  This movie has and will always be one of my favorites!

To appreciate the Goonies you need to have seen in as a kid in the 80's... Everything about this movie reminds me of what it was like to be a kid at that time. The toys, the video games, the clothes... the adventure. It would entertain children today, but the memories behind a lot of it would be lost. It has pride of place in my video collection and is one of my top 10 favourite movies. I only wish that I could have seen this at the cinema...

Review title: A must-see for kids of all ages...
Review_body: I was ten years old when I watched The Goonies for the first time. Mom took me to the cinema, and I bet she wasn't aware of what that film would mean to me. Now it's a bunch of years after, and it remains untouchable on my list of favorite movies. I think it's so charming, I mean, the whole mixture of pirates, adventure, humour, friendship, treasure-hunting, bad-but-dumb-criminals...even hints of teenage love! It's got everything you need to have a wonderful time in front of the T.V., just couch-potatoing with a big bowl of popcorn...I'd just say The Goonies is a must-see for kids of all ages, specially the ones in their mid-late twenties now, as that means they were same age as The Goonies when the movie plot took place.

Review title: One of the best films of the 80's
Review_body: I saw this in the movies when it first came out.  I was in love with this movie.  After it was released on video I rented it everyday until my mother threatened to destroy the vcr.  This movie brought the imagination of all young boys to the big screen.  Going into some secret tunnels and finding a pirate ship.  This movie has everything.  If you want to laugh like your a little kid again buy this film

Review title: the ultimate, greatest movie of ALL TIME!!! Should be on DVD
Review_body: my favorite movie of all time, people who love this movie should petition for a transfer to dvd

Review title: They have yet to make a kid's adventure like it.
Review_body: When I hear the wistful old saying of "ah, they don't make them like that anymore", this is probably the first film I think of. It is also one of those films where, after watching it, you beg and prey that there will be a sequel, just so as that you can see more of the characters, but you know that there won't be - like all great fantasy tales (the never-ending story not included!), it is a complete adventure with no loose ends. A timeless adventure that cannot be recreated. If you have not, for some insane reason, seen this film, do so. If it doesn't warm your heart with nostalgia, congratulations - you had a perfect childhood!

One of my favorite childhood movies that I still enjoy watching today. Data, Chunk, Mouth and all the rest made a very memorable film, and the new DVD with commentary from the Goonies today is awesome.  Too many great scenes, lines and characters to name here. One of the very few movies that I can watch over and over again.

Don't get me wrong here, i'm not trying to shoot holes in this, my most beloved film ever, perhaps... but the pirate freak in me (thanks to Depp and his crew) "can't help but wondering, what's in the bag?"... or more aptly put, were there really pirates in Oregon? One-eyed Willie seems like a classic "caribbean" pirate, and it seems unlikely that with no panama canal back then, a Spanish armada would chase a fleet of pirates down around the horn of south America and up into the frigid waters of the pacific northwest. if anybody has any info about actual pirates in this area of the world at that time, it'll help me sleep at night... otherwise, good one Spielberg.
The Goonies is a movie that has only one way to describe it AMAZING! Love everything about it.
I love this movie, it's one of my favorite movies :)

Review title: BEST MOVIE I HAVE EVER SEEN
Review_body: Goonies is my favorite movie ever. When I was a kid I would watch this movie all the time;I still do as an adult. Sometimes my friends and I will have goonies parties and dress up as our favorite characters and act out the movie. I strongly recommend to anyone that hasn't seen this movie to sit down after a long day and let their imagination take over. LONG LIVE SLOTH!!

"Hey you guyssss" GooniesIf you like adventure, mystery, comedy you would love this film. Goonies is based on a group of young boys named Chuck, Mickey, Mouth, Date and an older brother named Brand and two older girls named Andy and Stef searching for a lost pirate ship. The adventure the group runs into on the way to the treasure makes this movie not only comedy but also an emotional journey for the characters and the audience. Filled with puzzles, boobytraps and constant reminders of how many came before them the group works together to create a close bond through the adventure. The group realizes that after this they will all be separated and will never have an adventure like this again. They will be separated by time and distance.Before the movie came out the names alone of the director, Richard Donner, and the writers, Chris Columbus (screenplay) and Steven Spielberg (story by) already had a reputation for having good movies. Donner directed The Superman movies which were a hit. Spielberg is accredited with E.T. and Indian Jones with many other hit movies following. Chris Columbus was a screenplay writer for Gremlins which was referenced in the movie Goonies. With these three involved Goonies was destined to be a good movie.The group tested their luck hiring both a mix of seasoned and new actors to play leading roles in the movie. The new actors included Mikey (Sean Astin), Chunk (Jeff Cohen), Data (Ke Huy Quan), and Andy (Kerri Green). All of these actors had experience acting in one or less movies. The seasoned actors included Brand (Josh Brolin), Mouth (Corey Feldman), and Stef (Martha Plinpton). These actors all worked well together to make you feel like you were part of this group. The group of characters in this film have continued to make other notable films.The characters brought the overall feeling of the movie due to their high acting skills. Although some of these actors were new to acting they took on the role they were assigned well. Between the serious characters, the comedians, and the floaters the audience is able to identify with the characters and build a connection to their personalities. The director and writers made the characters consistent throughout the story which gave an understanding to the audience of what to expect from each character. From the beginning of the movie Mikey took on a serious role. This was first seen at Mikey's house when Chunk was trying to get in and Mouth would not unlock the gate until he did the Truffle Shuffle. Mikey made sure that they stopped playing around and let him in. Speilberg and Columbus showed throughout the movie that kids will be kids at even scary times. During suspenseful moments the group continues to crack jokes and still act like young boys.I would rate this movie 10 out of 10 stars! Spielberg, Columbus, and Donner have created a movie that is good for all ages. Goonies is the bomb go and watch it.

I love this movie. I thought it was one of the best movies from the '80s, but then again there were a lot of great movies from the '80s. I bought the movie and I watch it every chance I get when it is on TV. I would rate it four stars. If you haven't seen this movie you really should. It is a fun filled family movie that the whole family could enjoy. I hope you enjoy the movie as much as I did. The acting and the dialog where good. The different characters made the movie great. There were some points I laughed so hard I cried. This movie is sure to make you laugh. If you are ever feeling down just watch a good movie like this and you will be in a better mood for all the laughing you will be doing.

Review title: The Gold Standard for 80's kids films
Review_body: The Goonies is an absolutely classic children's film that will be a favourite for years to come. A superbly paced and well acted film, it keeps you energised and totally focused on the ensuing action.When I first saw the film, aged about 10, I was totally entranced from the dangerous treasure hunting stunts to the hilarious comedic elements involving Data and, of course, The Fratellis.I still watch this today on DVD (which by the way has a great reunion of the original cast on it - Chunk looks very different these days!) and it stands up as a film that can be watched and enjoyed by adults. It has a dreamlike innocence, without being mawkish, that is sadly lacking in many of today's films for children. Even better is the fact that this is achieved with a cast of kids who are not perfect, but reflect how kids really are. There are badly behaved, spoilt, obese, intelligent, sensitive, sports mad, vain, asthma-ridden and geeky characters on show but by the end you feel something for them all.An amazing film and a cultural reference point for growing up in the 80's.

This film is awful. The acting is horrid, the story non-existent and the pacing glacial. The only positive aspect of this film is nostalgia, and in the cold, hard face or adulthood even that is stretched thinner than the stars' acting abilities.

Been born in the 80s the goonies represents a good feeling, looking back now at some of the dialogue you can see how pc the world is now compared to then, is the world any better now, nope in fact it's worse, watching the goonies brings back such good memories 😊

Review title: One of the best adventure movies of the 80s
Review_body: This movie will be enjoyed by the whole family. Nostalgic feeling... as a 90 kids we were fascinated by irate ship, gold, treasure and adventure and this movie just have it all. And most importantly the value of friendship and family.

The first time I saw this movie it was listed on a double bill after "Top Gun" at a drive-in movie theater.  Since then I must have seen this movie hundreds of times.  It is just a great, family-oriented funny movie.  I have even gotten to the point where I can repeat it word for word.  Definitely a classic.HEY YOU GUYS!!!!

Review title: The Goonies a.k.a. the best family move of all time!
Review_body: After so many years ''The Goonies'' never get's old!The best family movie of all time!Story, characters, music, thrills, comedy, drama, it's all there! And everything works perfectly together!THUMBS UP!!!You really need to watch this movie if you still didn't!Chooocooolate!!! :)

On the one hand it is aimed at children but on the other it's totally inappropriate for children: e.g. The parts with the lifeless corpse staring into space with a bullet hole between the eyes. Full of annoying and shameless product placement. Has not aged well, so it is only really enjoyable to people who have a nostalgia about the film. Most of the humour is outdated, but there is the occasional funny moment.

What made this movie so funny is the little Chinese kid with the inventions. And also I had the hots for that one girl in the movie, can't remember who she is.
