All in all this movie captured a certain innocence, and magic seldom seen, especially these days. Only other movie I can think of that captured the same spirit is E.T.

Review title: A movie for all the family to see
Review_body: This movie is like the Indianna Jones for kids. It is filled with action, comedy, and drama and to top it off it is a whole lot of fun.It's a movie you can stick on at any time. Even your grandmother can watch it (if she doesn't mind the occasional bad language). The story is about four kids, Mikey, Mouth, Chunk & Data who set off on an adventure of a life to find hidden treasure from a pirate ship that was lost in the area hundreds of years ago. They have to do this within 24 hours because the rich kid in town, Troy, his dad is planning on bulldozing all the houses and making it into one big golf course.To make matters worse the kids have to get their before three wanted criminals the "Fratelli's" get to it first. Who find out about the treasure from Chunk. I don't want to give anymore away, u will have to watch it for yourself or see it again if u haven't seen it in a while.......

"The Goonies" is definitly one of my all time favorite movies! It reminds me of adventures I always use to fantasize about as a kid. The plot is about a group of outcast friends (they call themselves the Goonies) who find a treasure map of a long lost treasure. The kids, who are about to lose their houses decide to try and help their parents by embarking on the adventure of a lifetime. On their search for 'the rich stuff' they uncover the hideout of the Fratelli's, a family of bumbling bad guys. The child actors are amazing. My personal favorite is Mikey, (played by an adorable Sean Astin) the leader of the group. You may also see some other familar faces, like Corey Feldman-the wise cracking 'Mouth', Josh Brolin-macho big brother 'Brand', and Martha Plimpton-Andi's friend 'Stef'. This movie is a great childhood classic. I highly recommend it even if you are just a kid at heart. It has great 80's styles and feeling. It is a movie you can never get tired of, (believe me, I've seen this movie atleast 30 times!!!! And it is still one of my favorites.) If you haven't seen this movie yet go out and rent it! And if you have a DVD player, check out the DVD. It has a full length commentary by 'The Goonies' all grown up!I give this movie a 10/10!!!!!

Like a lot of you, The Goonies is one of the defining movies of my childhood. I saw it when I was six years old in Chicago. If I had seen it for the first time now, at 23, I'd probably not like it nearly as much. But that's the way it is, and it's one of my favorite movies. It's also got that Spielberg-feel of out-of-touch adults vs. wiser-than-they-look kiddies. Great stuff.

Alright, this movie was made 2 years before I was born and I still love it.I've seen it over 2 dozen times(though I don't own the movie)and Its great. the only problems I see with the movie are very small but notice able. Such as when the Fratelli brother is supposed to be singing he is shown in the car mirror smoking. Like i said small but notice able

Review_body: This was the best movie i have ever seen in m entire life!!!  A really funny movie that everyone of all ages should see.  A good movie about friendship and helping your friends.  I watch this movie all the time, and it always keeps me laughing.  Everyone needs to see this movie!!!

The "Goonies" is one of the classical 80s flicks, but is still unique. It is funny and entertaining; it's witty and mysterious. I just loved the "Goonies" it is one of my favorite 80s movies. Josh Brolin and Sean Austin were terriffic together. Kerri Green and Corey Feldman also did a great performance.

I watched this movie as a kid and loved it! It just totally reaches with a child of the 80's as an action-packed adventure. Obviously, its a bit dated now, what with all the visually impressive block busters we have nowadays. But I still find it funny and exciting, more as nostalgia of my childhood than anything else.

Review title: The Goonies is a non-stop adventure for the whole family!
Review_body: Welcome to Astoria, Oregon. At first glance, this small seaside community seems to be just another safe yet uneventful stop amongst small-town USA. However, between rogue bankers and escaped convicts, there is more trouble than meets the eye in Astoria! Enter the Goonies. Brothers Mikey and Brand Walsh team up with pals to make the self-named band of misfits, whom always seem to find themselves right in the thick of things. This time a group of development bankers are foreclosing on all the property around the Goonies' neighborhoods to make room for a new golf course. Now the Goonies must embark on a dangerous journey to find the infamous pirate One-Eyed Willy's hidden treasure, in hopes to pay-off the bank and save their families' homes. The Goonies treasure hunt is filled with twists and turns and not to mention a few booby traps! To top it all off the Goonies are being chased by the Fratellis, a criminal family fresh off a jail-break! Can they beat all the odds and save the day? Join Mikey and the gang as they take you on one treasure hunt that you cannot afford to miss!
My All Time Fav Movie.....it's a funny movie ....it's a great movie....it's just so adorable......:o)it should be a movie which HAS to be seen during your childhood! ha !

One word... Amazing!!! There is no other great movie where Sean Astin wears braces and has asthma. Corey Feldman is a sheer smart guy and nothing beats it. Chunk by the far is the best character especially when he is asked to do the famous truffle shuffle in his loud Hawaiian shirt. This movie even when I am 80 will be one of my favorites of all time and I by then will have seen over 10,000 movies I am sure. It is also sweet to see Joe Pantiliano in a criminal character role before the days of The Sopranos as Ralph. Sloth by far is the coolest character when he and Chunk become best friends. The young actors in this movie with the exception of Astin and Feldman did not have much of acting careers. Goonies forever!!!
I have watched this classic many, many times and was the sort of 80's film I grew up with as a child. HEY YOU GUYS!!!

The Goonies is just an absolute classic. I can watch this over and over and not get bored of it. Sean Astin (Mikey) is just perfect in his role. Jeff Cohen (Chunk) makes me laugh all the time. Corey Feldman (Clark) is also hilarious in a cool style. Jonathan Quan is just great in his supporting role with all of his inventions. All the obstacles that these boys face trying to get a treasure is just hilarious. They are trying to save their homes from being destroyed. They find a map in their attic that may be able to lead them to "One Eyed Willys" treasure. They run into many obstacles and each one is funnier and funnier. For anyone who hasn't seen this movie. Go get it.

Review title: A must see!, Bringing up those good old childhood memories
Review_body: When I saw this film I was about 13 years of age. I saw this film at my uncle's house. This film really got my attention. The feeling of going out on a adventure with friends became stronger. I wanted such a fantasy to become reality!

The Goonies is about a group of young adults that guide themselves into an adventure on the quest to find a legendary lost treasure. The film illustrates the importance of working as a team to beat impossible circumstances. Sean Astin plays the main character Mikey, who is first to discover an old treasure map in family home's attic. His brother Brand is played by a young, Josh Brolin. These two play opposites character wise. Brand is more athletic and strong while Mikey is smaller and has an external weakness of asthma. However it is Mikey that is the one who guides the group of misfits through an underground, booby trap adventure and discover the treasure. The brother's family home is about to be foreclosed on unless their parents can come up with the money.Other stars of the film include Goonies: Kerri Green, who plays Andy, a cheerleader and love interest to Brolin's character, Kerri Green, who plays Stef, Corey Feldman as Mouth, Jeff Cohen as Chunk, and Ke-Huy Quan as Data. The group is constantly on the run from the Fratelli crime family, who in the opening scenes helps one of their counterparts escape jail. Anne Ramsey plays Mama Fratelli, who discovers what the "goony" group is up to and prompts her sons Jake and Francis, who are played by Robert Davi and Joe Pantoliano, respectively, to chase after them. There is one more son, Sloth, played by John Matoszak, who is deformed and has a growling Frankenstein-like dialog. Sloth is left behind along with a captured Chunk who soon becomes friends over the love for food and they join forces to go save the "goonies" from the Fratellis who are on their trail. Each goony character played an important role in helping the group advance further in discovering the treasure. Those that stood out were: Mikey (Astin) who is the encourager that will not give up in helping his family and will not allow the group to give up either, Data (Quan), is equipped with special gadgets that help the goonies get through the trail to the treasure and Mouth (Feldman), is able to interpret the map which is in Spanish and helps to give the film a funnier edge with his smart antics. The character Sloth (Matoszak) ends up becoming an honorary goony for his attempts to rescue them from his family. The Goonies was an earlier kiddy version of the Disney film, National Treasure (2004), which stars Nicholas Cage as a treasure hunter who is looking for mysterious and unbeknown artifacts. Unlike The Goonies his adventures are around the entire country not just below one Oceanside suburb. Perhaps both films draw from the film, Indiana Jones (1981-1989, 2008), which stars Harrison Ford as a part time college professor and part time adventurous historian, who travels the globe to rescue artifacts from the wrong hands and put them in a museum. All these films focus on defeating the odds and a hero shining through at the end. However, I believe Goonies was the first to focus on a group of children on this type of quest. The film uses techniques in camera angles and lighting to give a more realistic feel to the viewer. There are points were you actually forget the adventure is really only taking place underneath a town. Throughout most of the film, low key lighting is used to draw the audience into the setting of the dark cave the group is in. It gives an eerie feeling while at the same time allowing for the element of surprise of what may be up next. It was also very natural like you are right there with the characters, especially when they use candles and flashlights as the main light source. A diagonal camera angle was used in some scenes to present an approaching feel. Especially when the group was traveling into the unknown as one. The characters are in a grouping of shortest to tallest from front to back to give this angle an even greater effect. These techniques were needed to bring the audience into the actions on the screen and engage their interest further.All the elements tie in to make this film enjoyable to watch and be a part of. Each character was able to hold your interest with their unique talent and ways. Each scene of their adventure will allow you to seem as if you are part of the effort to find the treasure. This film gives great significance to the word teamwork and will encourage those biggest to smallest to stop at nothing to make a dream reality.

A complete stupidity even for kids. Chaotic succession of events kids that are shouting without reason a monster with unexplained origin and a fat boy that is constantly becoming the clown of the company. What a waste of time

What is entertaining about this? I fail to understand what is so great about it. I am 13, I should be the target audience. I saw this movie during a kids film camp, and everybody thought it was so hilarious that.. what? Is it funny that a fat kid jiggles his fat and that there are kids cussing and whining. What really shocks me is that the kids in the camp loved this and hated "Spirited Away". IS MY GENERATION THAT STUPID?! I'm going to analyze this film a little further to prove my point, though:ACTING: The actors themselves aren't awful, although they become so annoying at times, you kind of wanted them to die. The one playing the kid with asthma was not captivating at all. He was bland and never showed any real emotion. The others weren't bad, and they probably did the best with the script they were given, which lead to my next point...SCRIPT: Oh yeah, this is where the movie gets awful. The script is just all around unoriginal. In 4th grade,(before I saw this film), I would write adventure stories that were at the same level of this. These stories I wrote were all, honestly: There's a group of kids they go on an adventure underground involving many obstacles like:balance beams, swinging axes, etc. they find treasure, then get out and return to normal life. Sound familiar? I mean, nothing original or interesting happens. I guess you could argue that the piano scene was O.K., but even that wasn't fantastic. The characters were beyond shallow, all bogged down to just stupid quirks. They have no depth and just come off as whiny. Don't believe me? Well, how much development do they have besides fat kid-wimpy, loves food,lies Asian kid-invents things main character- asthma, whispers teenage boy- works out other kid- tries to be cool, but is annoying. YOU NEED TO DEVELOP! but the one element of the movie that really pisses me off is the deformed brother that the villains were keeping in their basement. The fact that they could stoop that low to produce comedy is just horrendous. And what was funny about him? Was it funny that he couldn't talk properly and communicated through yelling? Was it funny that he was wearing a superman shirt? No, it's actually kind of sad, and I'm surprised a lot more people don't hate this movie for exploiting people born with physical deformities like that. They deserve as much respect as people, and this just cruelly makes fun of them.EFFECTS: The main reason I gave this film such a high rating is because the effects were really great. It wasn't beautiful, it was all very brown and gray, but I guess that isn't awful. That was at least pleasing to look at.Well, this is getting pretty long, so I think I'm going to stop. To summarize; while the special effects were great, that doesn't make up for undeveloped characters, a plain, boring script and just O.K. acting. I really, REALLY hate it, but if this is what appeals to you in a film,and it appeals to a lot of people, then just keep enjoying it. Just, don't ask to me to watch it with you.

This movie made all of us kids want to become The Goonies.  Most of us used our imaginations to be part of the movie.  To remember the Goonies Oath. To pretend to look for the gold, to run from the fratelli's, to hide in the pirate-ship and not touch one-eyed willy's gold.  This film had it all for us to fall in love with it. Now a days there are videos showing all the goof ups and the imperfections of this film.  But if your a true Goonies fan you won't want to see what imperfections this film had.  You'll want to remember it just as when you saw it for the very first time.

Even though to fully appreciate this film you need to have been a child or early teen in the 1980's, this movie still provides excellent entertainment value for today's youth. This movie is pretty much an ode to childhood exuberance, dealing with such fantastical issues such as pirate ships, hidden treasure, bad guys, booby traps (or booty traps whatever's your poison) and the art of having fun.The Goonies themselves are fairly likeable, though they do have a tendency to talk over each other; but I guess that's what kids do. Joey Pants and band of bad guys make for excellent villains, and give our heroes a good run for their money.All in all, get your purple rain t-shirt and head band start bopping away to cyndi lauper and her terrible theme song!

I saw this movie in the theater during its original release and it has continued to be one of my favorite movies of all time. Whenever this film appears on television I find myself helpless to turn the channel or shutoff the TV. I later found out that my father was good friends with Curtis Hanson, who played Elgin Perkens (Troys Father). He gave me a few little in-depth stories about the parts of the movie he was involved in and I found it quite interesting. I have seen this movie countless times and I was very pleased when the DVD was released and there were previously deleted scenes added. I love having a film that you have loved for years and years and then a special release comes out with scenes that you had never scene before. Anyone who has not seen this movie should put it on the priority list.
This is my all-time favorite movie. It has almost everything - action, adventure, mystery, humor. LOVE IT!

Review title: They Don't Make Em Like This Anymore
Review_body: Astoria Oregon is famous for two things. It's the filming location for The Goonies and it was the termination of the 18th Century Lewis and Clark Expedition. This is no coincidence. Kids want to believe in exploration and empowerment.1985 was right about the time when Nintendo emerged as a new past time for kids to hold up at home staring at a screen. And if kids did go out, they were likely headed to an arcade.Know your market. Donner and Spielberg knew exactly how to tug at the heart strings of kids looking for excitement and adventure. It's an hommage to exploration and Fantasy at a time when Children were considered an emerging market for toy and film companies; hence the popularity of the film.The Goonies wouldn't work in modern times. It's not believable that kids would hop on their bikes and go on an adventure. Kids in the suburbs need mom's car to go anywhere.Throw in an amazing soundtrack and stellar editing... I show this film to my 13 year old students every year. And they love it because we all long for some outdoor adventure in this age of smartphones, social media and video games. You need to be a kid or young at heart to really get this flick.

The Goonies is my all time favorite movie. I love everything about it, from the fabulous actors like Corey Feldman and Sean Astin to the amazing 80's soundtrack. My favorite song is "The Goonies 'r' Good Enough" by Cyndi Lauper, I even bought the soundtrack on ebay. If you liked this movie you might be interested in "Stand By Me" starring Corey Feldman and the late great River Phoenix or "The Princess Bride" starring Cary Elwes and Robin Wright. I have loved The Goonies since I first saw it when I was a kid and no movie I have seen since has come close to matching its greatness!

I hated this movie because it's just screaming without a plot. The kids have no empathy with the audience. The bandits do not scare anyone. One of the most important things you have in a kids movie it's the villain that must draw attention and be magnetic. Do The Gonnies have it? No! Not at all! Most critics here giving 7/10 upwards are just nostalgic freaks voting with childhood emotions. I fast forwarded after 30 minutes and kept doing until the end. It's inconceivable that people actually liked this movie. I read most comments giving 10/10 they are just saying the same thing "oh my childhood, oh my childhood, oh it's a classic". God! Please stop putting this garbage in a good rank! I don't like kids movies but you have so much better things out there that deserve much more ratings.

Review title: MY FAVORITE MOVIE OF THE UNIVERSE!
Review_body: I have loved this movie ever since I was 5 years old or younger.  I used to watch it everytime I went to my uncle's house (he had it taped form the tv) It ended up getting so old from me playing it over and over again. Finally my parents bought it when i was about 12 yrs. old and my sisters and I played it at least once or twice a month.  Christmas of 2002 my parents gave the DVD to me in my stocking and I cherish it!!! it's the best of all!  I also have two Goonies shirts, and a Goonie patch.  My favorite goonie is Mouth "Jerk Alert!"  I read the script for the sequel to the Goonies and it sounds good but I'm kind of skeptical, I'm affraid it won't do the first movie justice.  Well peace out everyone and remember... "Goonies never say die!"

Review title: Boring typical boy save world movie
Review_body: Yet another boys save town world type movie . Yawn Nothing Creative Or Original Thought Here. Cliche.
Please make a sequel, most all the cast is still relavant. Big budget, action and adventure fun mystery

THIS IS THE BEST MOVIE EVER!!! i love how it mixes attitude, adventure, mystery, comedy, and even romance...it is a great film for people of just about any age... i have been a goonie fan ever since i first saw the film...i am glad that there are as many that feel the same way... Whether it was Josh Brolin and his "older wiser talk" or Sean Astins "i love the adventure"...or Corey Feldmon a.k.a. Mouth and, his, well, mouth, there was always something to laugh at or feel some sort of emotion to...i love the fact that there is a film that can make me feel this way...the casting, and characters, and screenplay were excellent, that is why i rated this fun and adventurous movie at a 10...if you agree feel free to email me and talk with me about this great film of the 80's...

Just prior to graduating with a degree in Film Studies a lecturer asked us, "So what's your favourite film now?" Whilst my peers spouted out Goddard films and obscure German expressionist shorts I sat quietly thinking; my favourite film has been My Favourite Film since I was seven... So when it came to me and I mumbled "The Goonies", I was expecting scorn, ridicule and possibly minor injury, but instead was met with concurring shouts and whoops and cries of "Hey you gu-uys!" from the rest of the class. You see this is the unifying thing about The Goonies; mention it in a room full of twenty-somethings and they'll whell up and utter "Sloth loves Chunk" or adopt a harassed Chinese tone "Thats what I said...Booty traps!". And if that room happens to be a pub, several chairs will scrape back and semi-inebriated grown men will lift their shirts, shake their bellies and revel in the truffle shuffle. People may say it's an Indiana Jones wanna-be I think that is the defining beauty of it all. When we first watched The Goonies it was like watching our dreams come true on screen! We'd loved seeing Indiana's adventures and escapades and in The Goonies we saw kids like us actually doing it! They got to be just like the mini-Indies we imagined ourselves to be in the playground. But its not just the adventure that makes us love the film, we love those Goonies themselves. They were like our friends. We got annoyed with them sometimes, and we wanted to protect them, and we laughed at their jokes and cheered when they had a brilliant plan. Identifying with those kids was what we loved and why, as adults, we quote them and 'become' them when talking about the film. I still want to be like Andy, having a perilous adventure sliding down tunnels and facing the bad guys on a huge pirate ship... but of course also making time to kiss Brand AND Mikey! I also think that this is why Goonies 2 is such a relevant and exciting concept. We've all grown up together and I'd love to see how the guys are doing now...I just hope it doesn't disappoint... So if you've not seen it do it right now, and if you have kids sit them down, hold their hand through the scary bits and enjoy! They'll thank you in twenty years time!

I remember growing up with this film. It always gave me a warm feeling as if it was a true story and that some day it could happen to me. but then i grew up and as i grew older i seemed to love it more and more. its just the whole kids vs adults and that adults aren't always correct. i was born when this movies was made and yet as it gets older it becomes more of a classic to me. i will no doubt be showing every 1 i know in future the film so if you know some 1 that has not seen it. tell them to watch it and you watch their faces as they watch the movie because i guarantee when chunk does that shuffle or mouth tells every 1 to bang on the pipes they will be smiling and laughing along with the film. to be honest there's not any other film on the planet that id rather be left with then this one because it has every thing in it from adventure to thriller (when they getting chased in the cave).

Worth watching with kids
enjoyedcinematography,direction amazing work

Review title: Youth to aduthood The Goonies still rocks...
Review_body: I sat on my couch as an 8 year old, my Dad put a video in called The Goonies. He said i'm in for a treat. So 114 mins of car chases, gadgets, a truffle shuffle, caves, a kiss with an older woman, baddies, a pirate ship, gems, one eyed willy and sloth and i was hooked. I immediately rewound and watched it again. This was repeated for a lot of my childhood, reenacting scenes with my friends out in the garden. I have watched this film as a child and an adult, yet it has lost nothing. So If you want to return to the innocence of your youth and want to kick fratelli butt then Watch this film... You wont be disappointed... Roll on the sequel...

This is one of the best movies of all time, as I grew up watching this I have seen it loads of times, and can say it is a genuine masterpiece. All of the characters fit the part perfectly. The plot is so interesting, and action packed that you just want to watch it again and again. The funniest character has to be Chunk (truffle shuffle), the best looking Andy (obviously), and the most annoying Troy (grrr). There were talks of there being a sequel, but I think it would most probably ruin what has been built up in the first one, and without the original cast would be pointless. Lets hope they don't make it. My advice, WATCH THIS MOVIE.

Review title: PG ratings are kind of vague.
Review_body: Saw The Goonies at 10 years old and still like this movie. I have a 9 year old now, however, and found the sexual references and profanity a bit too much. Other parents may disagree or are more lenient. We have other movies that are PG rated that have no where close to the language in Goonies. You can read over the parental guidance link on IMDb to get the details. We watched the first 15 minutes of it on DVD and I decided to just turn it off. I don't remember all the profanity! Otherwise, it "would have been" a great movie for a kid to watch. Adventure without a lot of violence. I have friends that let their children watch Walking Dead.

Review title: Loudy, a bit vulgar, and not very smart
Review_body: This is one of the pearls defended by some of my friends with a similar age as "the movie to astonish your kids". But to be honest, I think the astonished was me. I saw the movie when I was a kid, but I didn't really remember too much (thanks god! I should have leaved it like that!). Now I regret to have seen it with my oldest. Just a bunch of kids screaming and swearing during a good part of the movie, fighting against time to discover a secret hidden in a very pathetic way, while a bunch of unattractive villains chase them to usual "they almost catched them" situations. Please, treat your kids as smart people, because they really are, and show them better adventure movies.

Review title: It was the best then and it still is today
Review_body: I was 14 when Goonies came out in the theaters. It fast became my favorite movie, and my brother's (he was 12), too. It was on our SelecTV cable box (remember that?) repeatedly in the next year or so and we knew every line of every character. It was amazing. I literally wanted to BE Kerri Green and, of course, would have loved to have had an adventure like the Goonies had (and to have kissed Josh Brolin).We went camping this last weekend in a yurt and there was a dvd player in it. I took Goonies and watched it with my 11 year old 3 times. He loved it. Much like my older son did (who owns a "Goonies Never Say Die" t-shirt) when we watched it together when he was about 10.It's classic. It's a solid story that kids everywhere can relate to. It's magical. It takes me right back to my childhood, too, everytime I see it.Awesome movie. Amazing cast. Movie magic 80s style. I love it and always will.
I never ever get tired of watching this film, I reminder of my childhood and an absolutely brilliant film!

Review title: You should watch this for yourself.
Review_body: This movie was as good as it was. I rated this based on zero being the Paris Hilton video and 10 being The Goonies. ON this scale, this was most definitely a 10. I don't know what 5 would be on this scale. Some movie that is not the Paris Hilton porn or The Goonies, but is something else altogether such as Stephen King's IT. This movie could therefore not be a 5, as it is not Stephen King's IT. Much as it is not the Paris Hilton video. However this movie is The Goonies, so it is therefore rated a 10, as a ten is The Goonies. This movie had actors in it. On a scale of 1 to 10 for the actors, 1 being a completely different movie, and 10 being this movie, this movie is rated a 10 for the actors. I hope you found this helpful.

The pirate ship sails away at the end."See this movie? This is my wish, my dream, and it didn't come true, so I'm taking it back! I'm taking it all back!!!" Corey Feldman's acting in this movie is so horrendous that he was never seen or heard from again. Last heard from in the Surreal Life (w/ MC Hammer). Hammer Time.This movie makes me sick and want to never live again. Steven Spielberg should have went bankrupt, and fat people around the world should unite against this hateful movie which makes everyone do the truffle shuffle for years to come. Every fat kid knows the shame and pain of the truffle shuffle!Die.

The Goonies, in my opinion is one of the best movies ever made. The 80's proved to be the best year for movies that bridged the gap between adult humor and children's humor. The actors in this movie were so convincing that I dreamed of being a Goonie. This was the "feel good movie" of the century. We could only be so lucky to have films like this made these days. Prates, adventure, treasure, friendship, comedy, teenage crushes, and action with out the gore and sex scenes. What else could you ask for? The Goonies is a movie that can be kept, and passed down through the generations. I continue to enjoy this movie as much as an adult, as I did as a child. The Goonies movie has been passed down to my own children,and I look forward to the day I will be able to introduce The Goonies to my grand children.

Review title: Don't just superficially watch The Goonies.
Review_body: In 1985 Steven Spielberg directed a movie titled The Goonies. There is much more to this movie than what simply meets the eye. The Goonies, follows a group of young hooligan boys around their hometown of Astoria, Oregon as they search for a mysterious buried treasure. The Goonies, one of Spielberg's funnier films focuses on younger people, because of this, many movie critics are harsh in their reviews towards. These reviews will sadden those who truly love the movie The Goonies. If watched superficially, what appears in is a bunch of annoying kids running around their hometown without parental supervision as they search for hidden treasure, as well as bad acting and not great filming. But The Goonies teaches lessons that are simple, beautiful, and even for some life changing.  Although the movie is focused on the younger generation all, old and young alike can enjoy and learn from these lessons. Critics have stated, "The storyline was weak." Another said, "The story is annoying." These critics have only ever watched this movie with a superficial lens, sadly they have failed to see what the movie is all about. Spielberg directed this summer popcorn film in such a way that it can be learned from. These lessons come to us as the Goonies express attributes through their actions as they adapt to the life crisis on hand. One of these examples happens when the young Goonies follow a map to an old summer home, and despite a scary looking family occupying the house they press on to see if they can find the next step on the map. Through this experience the young Goonies teach us the lesson of determination and courage, the attributes are vital in order for us to get through our own life crises. As the Goonies press on they face many traps created to kill them or make them so scared that they would turn around but, these young boys and girls have something driving them. A drive is something that will always help us to get through our lives crises, it will push us not to quit and to do whatever is necessary to reach our goals. Finally, the Goonies show an incredible amount of maturity for their age, with maturity they were able to see and understand what really was important. Having a clear understanding about what was really important to the Goonies, they were able to know what they must do in order for them to get through their crisis.          These are only three examples of how the Goonies personality traits throughout the movie can teach us to better prepare ourselves for when crises come into our lives. These of course are not the only lessons to be learned form The Goonies, but it is a good start. The Goonies is much more then just a silly kids action/adventure movie, its for all generations to learn and grow from. Steven Spielberg produced this movie knowing that he could hide some awesome lessons from the beginning of the movie to the ending credits. As you watch this movie don't just watch it it superficially but to watch it in a deeper way, for in this way will you learn from its lessons, you will soon bee defending this 1980 classic much more.
Do yourself a favour and never watch this film. It is so annoying and disjointed.

Review title: Watched it for the first time in 2017
Review_body: I grew up in the ninties and so I could've easily seen The Goonies when I was a kid, but for whatever reason (maybe the language) I never did.I watched The Goonies for the first time in my life this year as a young adult and despite the fact that I was watching through 2017 eyes, I was instantly brought back to my childhood. As if I knew the characters in this movie when I was a kid. As if I had seen the movie countless times as a kid.The Goonies is such a wonderful mixture of fantasy, adventure, wonder, excitement, exploration, and humor; combined with the classic Spielberg style, it's a film that makes a lasting impact and leaves you wanting more.Since watching the film, I've been looking for others like it, but to no avail. No number of "movies like the goonies" Google searches seems to be enough. I've been left to conclude, at least for the time being, that The Goonies is unmatched in the authentic mid-1980s adventure that it embodies.

>> I'm only doing this to complete my profile checklist XDEven though I wasn't born in the 80s or the 90s, I grew up mostly watching movies from the oldies, which are far more better than most movies today. I must say that this was the first 80s film I watched, and I loved it. I have many favorite classic movies, but this one by far is the best from the 80s, or other 80s films like "The Outsiders (1983)", "Stand By Me (1986)", "Children of the Corn (1984)", "The Breakfast Club (1985)", are some of the classic 80s films I like even though there's more. I gave this movie a 10 out of 10 because it's an adventure movie, and it's fun for the whole family. I don't want to spoil the movie for you guys, but if you haven't seen this movie already, you should watch it, it's very fun and entertaining to watch, or you can just watch the trailer to see what it looks like first.

For a movie that was made in 1985 there were so many great aspects. 1. You had these adventurous and curious children driven to find the secret of One Eyed Willie and his merry men of thieves and save there town from being turned into a Golf Course Resort... 2. You had the criminal family in the Fratelli's hot on the children's trail to essentially rob the robbers (One Eyed Willie and Crew) who were dead anyway. 3. The "Booby Traps" laid out and the obstacles to get to the treasure was enough for me as a young man sitting on the edge of his seat waiting for something horrible to happen to the children. OVER ALL it was very well laid out as now has become an iconic movie in my books 10 out of 10, A great family movie.... SEE MY INTERVIEW with ROBERT DAVI - JAKE FRATELLI - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15X6eP2yMNo

With The 'Goonies', Every Day is June 7th!This rowdy child's adventure flick is a must see no matter how old you are. It resembles a mixture between a Little Rascals movie and an Indiana Jones adventure film. The Goonies incorporates a treasure hunt-- action theme that the whole family would enjoy. It is a true 1980's classic written by Steven Spielberg and Chris Colombus. The movie takes place on the Pacific northwestern coastal town where a group of the "weird" kids at school convince each other to search for the hidden treasure on One-Eyed Willy's ship. Each iconic character has a unique attitude that brings such life to the movie. Whether it be between the junk food driven teen named Chunk, or the next Inspector Gadget named Huy-Quan, when they're all together, they'll make for an adventure film that will keep your attention the entire hour and 54 minutes.The Goonies also incorporates a heartwarming relationship story between a popular teenager and his lame younger brother that will leave you with a smile on your face. For a movie that was popular when my parents were kids, being made over 30 years ago, is still considered a classic to my generation today. June 7th was announced to be "Goonies Day" by the mayor of Astoria, Oregon where the film was shot in 1985. This legendary motion picture is a timeless film that will carry on for generations to come.

Best movie of ALL times! The ones of you that grew up watching it know what I am talking about. I was born in 1974, now we are in 2021 and I STILL watch and re-watch this movie with the same desire and excitement I had when I was a teen :) This movie is PERFECT and one of a kind. A must watch :)
Love this show, I have Watched this show over and over

Review title: For the child in all of us
Review_body: "The Goonies" was the the film my brother, sister and I watched everyday of the holidays as children, we played on our bikes, made up maps, made camps, tried to invent cool contraptions and always went looking for treasure. This film captures the essence of childhood, when you believed in miracles, had no fear and thought you could do anything. The film although made twenty years ago hasn't aged in a bad way at all, however it does manage to show just how bad the so called kids adventure films of today really are. "The Goonies" requires kids to use their imagination and to pretend. No matter how many times you see this film it doesn't get old, I still want to be a "Goonie", it's for the child in all of us and I always feel nostalgic seeing it again. If you are going to watch this movie, do yourself a favour get it on DVD. Do not watch it on television the film is always cut to shreds and parts of it do not make sense, besides it's one you should really own. If only they still made films of this quality with this much magic.

Did anyone else think it was a little weird that we saw the cheerleader's underwear so frequently in a made for kids movie, and that her skirt was extremely short even for today's standards? Maybe i'm just being a little sensitive but I just thought that it was a little awkward to see her panties over and over again. Maybe she should have been wearing shorts? Or maybe it was to appeal to the teenagers that are watching the movie. Personally I didn't find it offensive but doesn't that seem a little sketchy for an 80s movie to show the underwear of an underage girl in such an innocent movie? What do you think about it?

this is by far my most favorite movie in the world (with Stand By Me running a close 2nd) it has adventure,romance,comedy every thing a person would want in a movie. I'm only 13 years old, i wasn't even born when this movie was made. but my sister used to babysit for two kids, whom introduced this great movie to me, then i often saw it on t.v, but never the whole way through. then i rented it and completely fell in love with it. then i immediately started looking around in the phone book for movie places, i called about 16 places. until i found it at a used place. for $12.00. i asked my mom if we could go get it that night, but she said no. so then a couple nights later she surprised me with it.now i am pretty much making it a habit to watch it every single day. i can pretty much tell you when and where things are going to happen. i always say to my friends who watch it...look here comes the good part. i have memorized th whole movie.i have always liked 80's movies. my favorite used to be the breakfast club. i first judged it by the title i would say, Na it sounds pretty stupid. then i watched it and loved it then i soon became obsessed with Molly Ringwald movies like Sixteen Candles, which my mom showed me as one of her favorite movies. and the pretty in pink and all of that stuff, until i decided after i saw the goonies and stand by me that they were my new breakfast clubs (to which i memorized the whole movie too) i liked 80's movies with kids my age. even though stand by me had maybe one girl in the film (and that was Gordie's mother) AND THE GOONIES only had 2 girls who weren't my age i fell in love. i think that Richard Donner...a brilliant man.i HIGHLY recommend this movie to all adults who have had a pirate adventure once in they're life

This is one of very few movies that I can watch over & over again & never ever get sick of. My mother loved it, I love it & now my son loves it. There's just something about this movie that has had me hooked for years & years! My little boy watched it with me one night & now he can't get enough of it either. His favorite part is when Chunk does the "truffle shuffle". I hope they never make a sequel like they did with The Sandlot, it's never the same. I did some research on the filming locations, which took place mostly in Astoria, OR. & I hope to take a trip there (I'm only in CA) to see the filming locations & get photos of what it looks like today, compared to 26 years ago. It's also pretty cool how a movie you enjoyed as a kid still has you entertained & now entertains your child! Oh yeah, Chunk is now a lawyer in Los Angeles. He will probably always be known as Chunk.

Every kids dream.... a treasure hunt.
All these comments stating that it was rated high because we were kids when we watched it.... sure we were. It's for kids. And always will be and enjoyed by the age group it was intended for.
Now.... just have to get my grandkids to sit still and watch it.
